title: Player's Internet prerequisites for Ranked games
body:
To Riot.

Okay let's talk ranked, I'm not the best player or the player with the best internet in OCE. However I have noticed a lot of players do tend to Disconnect from ranked games during the mid 20 minutes of the game. As a person who was previously using TPG's Internet I understand the frustration that comes with unpredictable Internet and unexpected Dc's. But however as contradictory as it is to the statement i just made. Why would you play ranked if you know you are going to lag ? Like are these players intentionally joining games they know they will disconnect? So 
I don't know maybe if riot considered the idea of player internet prerequisites prior to joining ranked games and turning this idea in a more practical way. I know most of you will read this and view it as selfish ( to the extent that only people with good internet is able to compete in ranked games) But however, what about the people that needs to play the game with 1 or even 2 less people? it is unfortunate and I can live with if it's 1 out of 10 games but I honestly think the number of people who disconnect are more than that... And I'll probably get higher ranked players that would think "What a noob, learn to carry, it's because you can't 1 v 5" yes I am aware that I am not as good at the game, that is why I am writing  this article :) 

Kind Regards

replies.body: Actually... might not be a bad idea to put a connection check into the client, so when you click 'play' (for ranked only) it runs a quick latency, packet loss, jitter test... and displays the results. If outside 'normal' levels... could give you a warning, that if you enter a game and DC, you will get a more severe punishment...

This is possible, but in some cases (such as during the past month in my case) the internet may physically drop out at random times due to a cut cable in the area, and you do not reconnect. Telstra has one of those situations going on right now:
